timeline.message:
First commit for iammeter devices.

Signed-off-by: lewei50 <service@lewei50.com>

timeline.bodyText: What type of exception do you expect here? Can you specify the concrete type?
timeline.author: fwolter

timeline.bodyText: You should store the ScheduledFuture returned by scheduleWithFixedDelay() to a field, to be able to cancel it in dispose().
timeline.author: fwolter

timeline.bodyText: Since you specified a delay of 0 sec. when scheduling the runnable above, refresh() is invoked instantly. So, this is invocation of refresh() is redundant and could be removed.
timeline.author: fwolter

timeline.bodyText: As getConfigAs() is an expensive operation, can you move it to initialize()?
timeline.author: fwolter

timeline.bodyText: I think the stream must be closed after using it.
timeline.author: fwolter

replies.author: Hilbrand

timeline.bodyText: You should specify the concrete exception you want to catch, since catching Exception catches also all runtime exceptions.
timeline.author: fwolter

timeline.bodyText: Do you log the stack trace by intention?
timeline.author: fwolter
fwolter

timeline.bodyText: Can you add the @NonNullByDefault annotation?
timeline.author: fwolter

timeline.bodyText: This can be made static. Also it's good practice to append the unit to the field name e.g. TIMEOUT_MS. Please move it to the other fields.
timeline.author: fwolter

timeline.bodyText: The configuration is only assigned to the local variable. You might want to assign it to the class field.
timeline.author: fwolter
fwolter
fwolter

timeline.bodyText: Is there some implementation missing?

timeline.bodyText: The annotation has no effect since getConfigAs() always returns NonNull and can therefore removed.
timeline.author: fwolter

timeline.bodyText: See above.

timeline.message:
fix format

Also-by: Yang Bo<service@lewei50.com>
Signed-off-by: lewei50 <service@lewei50.com>

timeline.bodyText: This method is called for every channel linked. So if you have 5 items this method is called 5 times. That doesn't seem right. Better to cache the data. You can use the openHAB ExpiringCache. You call the object and if the time has exceeded it will retreive the data. For example I've used it with a 3 seconds timeout.
timeline.author: Hilbrand

replies.bodyText: codes changed to use ExpiringCache now.
replies.author: yangbo1979

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
             * @author yangbo - Initial contribution

timeline.author: Hilbrand

timeline.bodyText: This is not right. You should model the different types as different things. So in the xml you would see 2 things, 1 with all channels and 1 with the limited set of channels. You can then create 2 different classes, or maybe create 2 classes that each parse the specific data. and in the handler factory you can than pass that specific class to this handler based on the specific thing created.
timeline.author: Hilbrand

replies.bodyText: thanks for your advice,I have separated those into 2 thingHandler now.
replies.author: yangbo1979

timeline.bodyText: Is the user/password configurable? In that case it should be a thing parameter. Also it's better to pass it as a header parameter instead of putting in the url.
timeline.author: Hilbrand

timeline.bodyText: In this case the status should probaly also be set to OFFLINE.
timeline.author: Hilbrand

replies.bodyText: I don't see the updateStatus here. Is it done somewhere else?
replies.author: Hilbrand

timeline.author: Hilbrand

timeline.bodyText: Related to the class splitting. I didn't intend for you to completely copy paste the code as it duplicates a lot of code. Better make an abstract base class with all the logic and let it call methods to do the specific code. The code I selected here would be in the sub class. The method would get the response as parameter. You can make the method getDecimal  protected (better rename it getQuantityState probably`.
timeline.author: Hilbrand
Hilbrand
